definition: to express/to present/to extend/to tender (greetings, thanks etc)
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]

sentences.english: So, once again, my best wishes to the College at the start of another academic year.
sentences.chinese: 因此，再一次在新学年向学院致以我最诚挚的祝愿。

sentences.english: Wrm greetings nd biggest wishes for the New Yer!
sentences.chinese: 致以猛烈的祝贺和良好的祝福，新年快乐。

sentences.english: The other teachers gave him their highest respect.
sentences.chinese: 其他老师都对他致以最高的敬意。

sentences.english: At this time of sorrow, deep sympathy goes to you and yours.
sentences.chinese: 在这悲戚的时刻，谨向和的亲致以深切的慰问。

sentences.english: Send you our everlasting feeling of gratefulness and thankfulness on this special day。
sentences.chinese: 在这特别的日子谨向您致以我们永恒的感激之情。

sentences.english: Send you our everlasting feeling of grhcommerciingfulness and thankfulness on this speciing day.
sentences.chinese: 在这特别的日子谨向您致以我们万世的感谢之情。

sentences.english: Allow me to extend my warm welcome and new year greetings to all of you.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我向你们表示热烈的欢迎并致以新年的问候。

sentences.english: Mr. Li Tieying, new President of Toy Shan Association, extended his holiday greetings to the guests.
sentences.chinese: 台山同乡会新任会长李铁英向来宾致以新春问候。

sentences.english: Best wishes for your happy birthday and congratulations.
sentences.chinese: 祝华诞快乐并致以最美好的祝愿。

sentences.english: Raisa and I send to you and Barbara our very best wishes.
sentences.chinese: 赖莎和我向你与芭芭拉致以最美好的祝愿。

sentences.english: I extend sincere apologies to the president for this lack of civility.
sentences.chinese: 我为这种缺乏礼貌的行为向总统致以诚挚的歉意。

sentences.english: You deserve this splendid success sincerest congratulations.
sentences.chinese: 愧，谨此致以诚挚的祝贺。

sentences.english: "Love and prayers to MJ 'King of Pop,"' she tweeted.
sentences.chinese: 向流行之王MJ致以我的爱和祈祷。

sentences.english: Pray allow me to congratulate you most heartily on your success in your examination.
sentences.chinese: 闻你考试成绩良好，请让我向你致以最衷心的祝贺。

sentences.english: With warm congratulations and best wishes to you for every coming festival.
sentences.chinese: 对来临的佳节，致以热情的贺候和良好祝愿。

sentences.english: Happy new year!Wishing that we will be soon together.
sentences.chinese: 向您致以新年的祝福，希望不久我们就能相聚。

definition: expression of gratitude/to give thanks/a thank-you note/acknowledgement
to grieve over sb's death/to lament sb's death/mourning
to express sympathy, greetings, consolation etc
to offer humbly (written at the end of letter from sb of lower status to higher status)/your humble servant
to congratulate respectfully/to wish good luck and success (esp. to a superior)/with best wishes (in writing)
